fields.description:
Hi,

I have been trying to set up a mail server within Confluence (both on our live system, v4.3.3 and our Dev system - v5.1.4) to use Microsoft Office 365 as it's SMTP server and every time I try a test mail I get a message starting with the following text:

An error has occurred with sending the test email:
com.atlassian.mail.MailException: javax.mail.MessagingException: [EOF]

I have searched for answers on this but not found any conclusive evidence which could show me whether this will work or not.

Could you please let me know if Office365 is actually supported, and if so, what do I need to do in order to get this working?

Thanks,

Jim
fields.summary: Email setup not working with Office 365

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-30475].
  {panel}

As stated in the thread below, Widget connector fails to display Youtube videos in the latest Firefox release, 23.x.
* https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/202851/youtube-is-blank-in-firefox-2-3-1

h4. Steps to reproduce:
# Add the Widget Connector to a page
# Insert any Youtube video link
# Save

h4. Results
The video is rendered perfectly in Chrome 28.x, but Firefox 23.x displays only a blank gap
fields.summary: Widget connector not working for Youtube in Firefox 23.x

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce.

This only happens when table content has links.

fields.description:
h5. Summary
Whenever an external gadget (not from Atlassian products) is added into Confluence, it doesn't work. Sniffing the error using firebug will reveal this error:
{code}
"Requests to http://www.nonexistance.com/json/builders/ are not allowed. See your administrator about configuring a whitelist entry for this destination (http://confluence.atlassian.com/x/KQfCDQ )."
{code}
However, the whitelist configuration had already been set to *Allow all URLs*. Therefore the error is somehow misleading. 

_*error in the logs*_
{code}
2013-08-20 18:00:39,576 WARN [http-8436-4] [renderer.internal.http.HttpClientFetcher] fetch A request to http://www.nonexistance.com/json/builders/ has been denied.  To allow requests to this URL add the application URL to your whitelist (http://confluence.atlassian.com/x/KQfCDQ ).
 -- url: /confluence/plugins/servlet/gadgets/makeRequest | userName: admin | referer: http://localhost:8436/confluence/plugins/servlet/gadgets/ifr?container=atlassian&mid=141734051840&country=GB&lang=en&view=default&view-params=%7B%22writable%22%3A%22true%22%7D&st=atlassian%3A1KUXMudmWkVx3a%2FiHuowS2WgxOCr4taqOFSPHWqoVnS0EGVG%2BAegKTol%2B2dINQ9N98J11hrlW1eaCw409dIp2JvM7%2FCKPdk3N6JJnHv%2Fef%2BFHcuyQ0JPCcqBCOKEm9B%2Fqb7wkHv2DxE7xH0qto%2B5iN6LWtC66WTNdoPpDj13xVsGSljalrza5zL3%2BEPsVTX6EeQouQ%3D%3D&up_baseURL=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.nonexistance.com&up_category=&url=http%3A%2F%2Flocalhost%2Ftest.xml&libs=auth-refresh
2013
{code}

h5. Steps to reproduce
# Host the external gadget's .xml file into Apache server. Confirm this by accessing the file through browser using http://localhost/test.xml. 
# Add the gadget via gadget url into Confluence by {{Confluence Admin >> External Gadgets}}.
# Configure Whitelist to allow all URLs.
# Run Firebug in Firefox.
# Create a new page and try adding the gadget. Before saving it, click Refresh and note the error in Firebug
fields.summary: External gadget cannot be added into Confluence with misleading error

fields.description: LDAP/Crowd users are unable to edit non-LDAP/Crowd attributes (e.g. Department, Position, etc), if the target LDAP/Crowd directory does not allow User Attribute modification, but the directory is set to *Read/Write* in {{Confluence Admin >> User Directories}}. Ironically, setting the directory configuration to *Read Only* allows users to modify those attributes again (*Workaround*).
fields.summary: Unable to update non-LDAP/Crowd attributes in the User Profile

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-30462].
  {panel}

We don't tell you what the autocomplete shortcuts are for emoticons which are embedded on pages. 

If you use the dialog Insert > Emoticon we show you this:
!http://cl.ly/image/262z1H1t2i3e/Image%202013.08.20%208%3A50%3A22%20AM.png!

However once you embed it on the page, we don't give you any tooltip on viewpage of what the shortcut is. 

A suggestion is to 
1. Switch them to the AUI "chunky" tooltips style - give them more affordance. (see https://developer.atlassian.com/design/latest/tooltips.html)
2. Add the tooltips on viewpage
fields.summary: Improve emoticon discoverability in editor by adding tooltips for emoticons

fields.description:
During the Confluence installation Wizard, options for the database are listed which are unsupported.  This can be misleading and and cause confusion to user (aka, why would we offer them if we do not support them).  As of 5.2.3, the following are listed and I would advise removing them.

* DB2
* Sybase ASE
* Oracle 8i
* Oracle 9i/10g

What we can keep is the 'unsupported' option which leaves no room for confusion.
fields.summary: Remove unsupported databases from installation wizard

fields.description:
In certain situations, the mail queue can fail to automatically process any of the mail items in its queue. With debug logging enabled for com.atlassian.quartz.jobs, the following message will appear in the logs:
{noformat}
Task queue: mail was already being flushed - skipped this time
{noformat}

No more output is given. Restarting will restore the queue to correct operation, but will lose all mail queued (since Confluence does not persist its mail queue).

h3. Workaround
Navigate to Admin > Mail Queue and select Flush Mail Queue
fields.summary: Mail queue can fail to flush automatically

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-30443].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce:
* add jira issues macro to a page
* modify the list of columns to be 'Key;Summary'
* notice how the Summary column is not shown when the page is saved.

Dynamic mode could handle column names in a case insensitive way whereas static mode cannot. This is a critical issue because we have changed the default mode of the macro from dynamic to static. Meaning once people upgrade they might have problems if they defined custom column list with capitalised names.
fields.summary: Static mode of jira issues macro (default) cannot handle capitalised column names
Update Office connector to support Word 2013 document import

Almost all material came through fine but now a huge version of the uploaded default Space Icon appears on the dashboard as shown in the attached images, along with new user video section (creating a horizontal scroll bar where none was before).

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-30431].
  {panel}

*Steps to Reproduce:*

*Note:* I've attached a a [XML backup of a page|https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/99422/IT-155110-79.xml.zip] that replicates this problem.
# Create a 1x2 table, and insert enough text in the right column that you would expect it to run onto a second line when exported
# Attach a large image to the page, and resize it to, for example, 900px
# Export page to pdf

*Expected Results:*
The text should wrap. Eg:
!Screen Shot 2013-08-16 at 4.02.00 PM.png!

*Actual Results:*
The text runs off the page:
!Screen Shot 2013-08-16 at 4.00.23 PM.png!


*Notes:*
This *does not* occur if the image is left in its original size.

*Workaround:*
Use [sections|https://confluence.atlassian.com/conf56/working-with-page-layouts-and-columns-and-sections-658736841.html] rather than tables.

Or make a change in PDF Stylesheet:
{code}
img
{
 -fs-fit-images-to-width: 100%  !important;
}
{code}
fields.summary: Large images in tables cause the tables to be cut off when exported to PDF

fields.description:
h3. The problem
Existing JIRA Issues Macros do not show any data after upgrade to Confluence 5.2.3. Editing the page then resaving has no effect on the {{($\{entries.size()\} issues)}} text. Editing the macro itself and re-saving the page resolves the issue

Viewing the raw source without editing the jira macro looks like the code below:
{code}
  <ac:macro ac:name="jiraissues">
    <ac:parameter ac:name="title">5.7: BAU Release items</ac:parameter>
    <ac:parameter ac:name="height">300</ac:parameter>
    <ac:parameter ac:name="columns">Type;Key;Summary;Priority;Status;Assignee;QC Reference;External Reference</ac:parameter>
    <ac:parameter ac:name="url">http://url.com/sr/jira.issueviews:searchrequest-xml/27321/SearchRequest-27321.xml?tempMax=1000</ac:parameter>
  </ac:macro>
{code}

Editing and saving the page has no impact. However, editing the jira macro and then saving it (without actually changing it) it will then change the source to the following:
{code}
  <ac:macro ac:name="jira">
    <ac:parameter ac:name="columns">Type;Key;Summary;Priority;Status;Assignee;QC Reference;External Reference</ac:parameter>
    <ac:parameter ac:name="server">ITSS JIRA</ac:parameter>
    <ac:parameter ac:name="serverId">d3d13785-344a-3b8f-87be-7149ef11eca2</ac:parameter>
    <ac:parameter ac:name="jqlQuery">project = Project AND fixVersion in ("5.7.0") AND labels in ("5.7-Release-Item") AND labels not in (ACL) ORDER BY key DESC</ac:parameter>
  </ac:macro>
{code}
Note the change from using url to using jqlQuery

h3. Workaround
# Upgrade [JIRA Issues Macro|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/confluence.extra.jira] to 5.0.2 if it is not yet at that version (Admin > Manage Add-ons)
# Edit the page with the macro on it
# Edit the macro (no need to change anything, just bring up the edit screen)
# Resave the page

NB: Be aware of [CONF-30428|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-30428] - if you currently have macros that reference filters, the macros will be decoupled from the filters and the JQL will be used instead.
fields.summary: Existing JIRA Issues Macros display (${entries.size()} issues) instead of issues after upgrading to 5.2.3

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-30428].
  {panel}

h3. The problem
Inserting a URL to a saved filter, eg {{http://localhost:9604/browse/TEST-3?filter=10000}} autocompletes to the JQL content of the filter - 'description ~ "description"' in my test case - so when filter 10000 changes, the JIRA Issues  will still be 'description ~ "description"'. This is not the same as previous behaviour, where the filter would remain in the macro and changes to the filter would be reflected in Confluence.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create and view a filter in JIRA
# Copy the URL
# Create a JIRA Issues Macro in Confluence 5.2.3
# Paste the URL into the macro
#- Observe that the URL is immediately changed to the JQL of the filter.
# Save the JIRA Issues Macro
# Change the filter in JIRA so that the results are different
# Reload the Confluence page
#- Observe that the results do not reflect the changes to the filter
fields.summary: JIRA Issues Macro filter behaviour has changed so that it no longer saves the filter, but rather hard-codes the results.

fields.description:
I have upgraded confluence 5.1.5 to 5.2.3 version. After upgraded successfully, i try to surf the page and it return 500 error with exception:

 java.lang.ClassCastException: com.atlassian.crowd.embedded.atlassianuser.EmbeddedCrowdUser cannot be cast to com.atlassian.confluence.user.ConfluenceUser at com.atlassian.confluence.user.AuthenticatedUserThreadLocal.get(AuthenticatedUserThreadLocal.java:39)

when i hit enter at url again it backs to normal. Is this version affect the custom authenticator(custauth-1.0.jar) behavior?
I am using ntlm login connector for my site.
fields.summary: com.atlassian.crowd.embedded.atlassianuser.EmbeddedCrowdUser cannot be cast to com.atlassian.confluence.user.ConfluenceUser

fields.description:
If you create a user macro which uses the method {{getSortedChildren()}}, it works fine when rendering the page or for a single page PDF export. If you take a PDF export of a space, the method {{getSortedChildren()}} returns no children pages. Sample user macro (shows a list of child pages): {code}## @noparams #set ($pageListArray = []) #set ($currentPage = $action.page) #macro ( process $rp ) #set ($pagelist = $rp.getSortedChildren() ) ## returns List #foreach( $child in $pagelist ) #set($p = $pageListArray.add( $child ) ) #if( $child.hasChildren() ) #process ( $child ) #end #end #end #process ( $currentPage)

Confluence Page Versions

#foreach( $child in $pageListArray) ## child is of type Page #end
Page Title
$child.getTitle()
{code}
fields.summary: Method getSortedChildren() does not return anything on Space PDF export

However, when we saved, the JIRA list was empty.

If I edit the macro on the preview page, the "search" field lists accurate values:

"project = CAYENNE AND fixVersion = "3.2.5" ORDER BY updated DESC, priority DESC, created ASC"

and the preview below shows all the JIRAs that match the above criteria. Once saving the page, nothing is displayed.

fields.description:
# two node cluster setup
# install the _Confluence Gliffy Plugin_ on one node (called producer node from now on)
# ensure that the plugin and it's state was successfully synced by visiting _/plugins/servlet/upm#manage_ on the other node (called consumer node from now on)
# disable the plugin on the producer node
# ensure that the disabled state got synced on the consumer node
# re-enable the plugin on the producer node
# refresh _/plugins/servlet/upm#manage_ again on the consumer node

You will see that the producer node shows "89 of 89 modules enabled" and the consumer node shows "88 of 88 modules enabled" for that plugin.

!Selection_123.png|thumbnail!

Also when the plugin is disabled, both nodes will show "0 of 88 modules enabled". The missing module is the "Rest Servlet Filter(gliffy-api-rest-filter)". Note that the missing module is not part of the atlassian-plugin.xml descriptor and seems to be added dynamically by the [RestModuleDescriptor|https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/atlassian-rest/src/c6ebb308832bc2a2cb96a36ca7488857f2442cb0/atlassian-rest-module/src/main/java/com/atlassian/plugins/rest/module/RestModuleDescriptor.java?at=atlassian-rest-parent-2.8.0-m2#cl-167].

I've constructed a minimal plugin

{code}
<atlassian-plugin key="rest-test" plugins-version="2">
	<rest key="rest-rest" path="/rest/test" version="1.0"/>
</atlassian-plugin>
{code}

and put this in a file named atlassian-plugin.xml and compressed it with the zip algorithm into the attached _rest-test.jar_. But if I install this plugin via UPM into the cluster and disable/enable it, the state gets correctly propagated and the receiving node will still have a _Rest Servlet Filter(rest-rest-filter)_ module.

!Selection_124.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Gliffy stops working on other cluster nodes after re-enablement

fields.description:
In Confluence 5.2, labels stopped getting indexed as part of a page. To reproduce:

# Create a page with a title "foo" and page content with just the word "foo"
# Add the label "bar" to that page.
# now search for "bar" from Confluence search.

*expected result:* the "foo" page will appear in your search results.
*actual result:* the "foo" page _doesn't_ appear in your search results.
fields.summary: Labels not getting indexed as part of the page
Clean up drafts and their attachments after a configurable period of time
Help text on reorder pages does not appear if you are not a space admin

fields.description:
I couldn't work out what sort of pattern matching the Filter By File Extension option was doing on the Space Attachments macro, under Confluence 5.0.  So I hit Help, searched for Filter By File Extension, and got taken to this page:

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONF50/Displaying+a+List+of+Attachments

The description of that field contains a link to a generic tutorial on regexp matching, none of which actually works in that field.  ".*" doesn't match anything, for example.  What's more, besides the link the doc contains two concrete examples of patterns to use: ".*jpg" and ".*jpg,.*png"  Neither of those examples work either.

I experimented a bit with patterns to see what sort of pattern it is meant to accept, but I'm left a bit unsure; one way or the other though, either the doco is incorrect, or the regexp matching isn't working.
fields.summary: Space Attachments macro Filter does not work as documented

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-30397].
  {panel}

See: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/UPM/Problems+Connecting+to+the+Atlassian+Marketplace

In the passage:
"What's going on:

The UPM must be able connect to the Atlassian Marketplace website to perform a number of functions, such as checking for add-on updates and installing new add-ons.

If you encounter network-related problems while using UPM, try the following troubleshooting steps:

Check whether a firewall is blocking UPM access to the Atlassian servers, for example, by attempting to ping the marketplace.atlassian.com server from the computer that hosts the Atlassian application. For more information, see Configuring Marketplace Connectivity.
Universal Plugin Manger needs access to:
*.atlassian.com
https://dq1dnt4af4eyy.cloudfront.net/
By default, UPM uses the proxy settings of the host application to connect to the Marketplace. If UPM cannot connect to the Marketplace server, you should verify the proxy configuration for the host application. Refer to the documentation for the Atlassian application for instructions for configuring proxy settings, keeping in mind that you'll need to include the HTTPS configuration:"

"Universal Plugin Manger" should be "Universal Plugin Manager"
fields.summary: Typo in Confluence documentation

fields.description: See attached image - we are using the documentation theme
fields.summary: There are two headers on new search page in confluence 5.2.3

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-30395].
  {panel}

Looking at this documentation:

https://developer.atlassian.com/display/CONFDEV/Remote+Confluence+Methods#RemoteConfluenceMethods-Pages
Looks like it allows to  update the actual properties of a Page, add comments and notify watchers.

However if we read this: 
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-4288?focusedCommentId=133095&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-133095

It informs Confluence does not allow to add comments or notify the users when editing pages via API. Basically the documentation is not clear.
fields.summary: Request Improvement Regarding API Documentation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-30394].
  {panel}

Looking at this documentation: 
* https://developer.atlassian.com/display/CONFDEV/Remote+Confluence+Methods#RemoteConfluenceMethods-Pages

Looks like this is designed to update the actual properties of a Page object, and StorePAge is to adding comments or updating a page.

However if we read this:

*    https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-4288?focusedCommentId=133095&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-133095

According to this information it tells that Confluence does not allow you to add comments or notify the users when editing pages via API. That being said, the updatePage()' method, should be used  just to comment a page(not add comments) and notify watchers.

Basically the documentation is not clear.
fields.summary: Request Improvement regarding storePage and UpdatePage API

fields.description:
E.g. this was working in confluence 3.x
{code}
[(?)|home]
{code}
Now it's a broken link.

Now our users have to use a workaround like this or a user macro: 
{code}
          <ac:link>
            <ri:page ri:content-title="home"/>
            <ac:link-body>
              <ac:image>
                <ri:url ri:value="https://wiki.komax.org/images/icons/emoticons/help_16.png"/>
              </ac:image>
            </ac:link-body>
          </ac:link>
{code}
fields.summary: Linking an emoticon to a wiki page isn't possible in the new editor.

fields.description:
In the previous version, when you click the download button for the pdf file, the file will be open in the browser internal PDF viewer. From there, the user have an option to download the pdf file or just view it like that.


!browser.png!

In 5.2.3, when you press the download button for the PDF file in a page, the user will be prompted with the download box straight away.
!download.png!
fields.summary: PDF file doesn't  don't open with Chrome's/firefox  internal PDF viewer

fields.description:
h4.Steps to Reproduce:
 (!) Confluence page should be in German language
 
 # Create a page
 # Create a child page for your page
 # Try to remove the parent page.
 
h4.Expected Results:
When using English language in Confluence there is a warning that says *Removing this page will move the child pages to the top level of space* as you can see below.
!english.png!
h4.Actual Results:
The German version does not show that message as you can see below.
!german.png!

h4.Findings:
I tested this behavior on Confluence 5.1.4, and the translation works fine for Confluence 5.1.4.
fields.summary: German translation does not show the warning of "Removing this page will move the child pages to the top level of space" when deleting the parent page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-30390].
  {panel}

I have a table that lists network devices with IP addresses. It would be useful to be able to sort by IP address so I can view devices per subnetwork.

However, it seems that Confluence fails to sort if there are no letters in that column.

Case in point: I tried adding a letter ("c" in my case) to any cell in that column and sorting worked. After removing the letter, sorting did not work.

I don't have access to this Confluence instance's logs at the moment, but I'm fairly sure Confluence runs into an exception when trying to sort this column.

To reproduce:
# Copy this into a Confluence page and try to sort by the different columns.
|| Device || IP || Location ||
| A | 192.168.0.1 | New York |
| B | 192.168.1.1 | Los Angeles |
 You should see that sorting by 'Device' or 'Location' works fine, while sorting by 'IP' does not.
# Add a letter after either IP. Now try sorting by that column again. Sorting should now work.
fields.summary: If table column only contains numeric values (such as IP addresses), sorting does not work for that column

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:-

1. Create two spaces A and B
2. In the "A Home" page create an Excerpt and images in it.
3. In the "B Home" page include the "A Home" excerpt.
4. Export HTML of space B

Result 
!example.png!

The attachment is not found in the export therefore it is not rendered.
fields.summary: HTML Export doesn't include included excerpt images from newly created page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-30388].
  {panel}

The PDF preview can't render certain PDFs and will display only blank, white pages.

The problem occurred with scanned documents which where saved with JBIG2 image compression (the default for Acrobat 5.0 and newer).

This is the resulting stack trace:
{code}
Error reading image                  
com.sun.pdfview.PDFParseException: Unknown coding method:JBIG2Decode
            at com.sun.pdfview.decode.PDFDecoder.decodeStream(PDFDecoder.java:114)
            at com.sun.pdfview.PDFObject.decodeStream(PDFObject.java:344)
            at com.sun.pdfview.PDFObject.getStream(PDFObject.java:276)
            at com.sun.pdfview.PDFObject.getStream(PDFObject.java:270)
            at com.sun.pdfview.PDFImage.getImage(PDFImage.java:224)
            at com.sun.pdfview.PDFRenderer.drawImage(PDFRenderer.java:284)
            at com.sun.pdfview.PDFImageCmd.execute(PDFPage.java:643)
            at com.sun.pdfview.PDFRenderer.iterate(PDFRenderer.java:583)
            at com.sun.pdfview.BaseWatchable.run(BaseWatchable.java:101)
            at com.benryan.conversion.PdfSlideConversionBatchTask.convertFile(PdfSlideConversionBatchTask.java:100)
            at com.benryan.conversion.PdfSlideConversionBatchTask.convertFile(PdfSlideConversionBatchTask.java:27)
            at com.benryan.conversion.AbstractSlideConversionTask.call(AbstractSlideConversionTask.java:44)
            at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask$Sync.innerRun(FutureTask.java:303)
            at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:138)
            at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.runTask(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:886)
            at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:908)
            at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:662)
java.lang.NullPointerException
            at com.sun.pdfview.font.TTFFont.getOutline(TTFFont.java:171)
            at com.sun.pdfview.font.CIDFontType2.getOutline(CIDFontType2.java:270)
            at com.sun.pdfview.font.OutlineFont.getGlyph(OutlineFont.java:130)
            at com.sun.pdfview.font.PDFFont.getCachedGlyph(PDFFont.java:308)
            at com.sun.pdfview.font.PDFFontEncoding.getGlyphFromCMap(PDFFontEncoding.java:155)
            at com.sun.pdfview.font.PDFFontEncoding.getGlyphs(PDFFontEncoding.java:115)
            at com.sun.pdfview.font.PDFFont.getGlyphs(PDFFont.java:274)
            at com.sun.pdfview.PDFTextFormat.doText(PDFTextFormat.java:269)
            at com.sun.pdfview.PDFParser.iterate(PDFParser.java:745)
            at com.sun.pdfview.BaseWatchable.run(BaseWatchable.java:101)
            at com.sun.pdfview.BaseWatchable.execute(BaseWatchable.java:263)
            at com.sun.pdfview.BaseWatchable.go(BaseWatchable.java:197)
            at com.sun.pdfview.PDFFile.getPage(PDFFile.java:1546)
            at com.benryan.conversion.PdfSlideConversionBatchTask.convertFile(PdfSlideConversionBatchTask.java:86)
            at com.benryan.conversion.PdfSlideConversionBatchTask.convertFile(PdfSlideConversionBatchTask.java:27)
            at com.benryan.conversion.AbstractSlideConversionTask.call(AbstractSlideConversionTask.java:44)
            at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask$Sync.innerRun(FutureTask.java:303)
            at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:138)
            at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.runTask(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:886)
            at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:908)
            at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:662)
{code}

Saving the file with CCITT Group 4 compression (see screenshot) will serve as workaround, i.e. the preview will be able to render the image, but the parser still outputs an (different) error:

{code}
 java.lang.NullPointerException
        at com.sun.pdfview.font.TTFFont.getOutline(TTFFont.java:171)
        at com.sun.pdfview.font.CIDFontType2.getOutline(CIDFontType2.java:270)
        at com.sun.pdfview.font.OutlineFont.getGlyph(OutlineFont.java:130)
        at com.sun.pdfview.font.PDFFont.getCachedGlyph(PDFFont.java:308)
        at com.sun.pdfview.font.PDFFontEncoding.getGlyphFromCMap(PDFFontEncoding.java:155)
        at com.sun.pdfview.font.PDFFontEncoding.getGlyphs(PDFFontEncoding.java:115)
        at com.sun.pdfview.font.PDFFont.getGlyphs(PDFFont.java:274)
        at com.sun.pdfview.PDFTextFormat.doText(PDFTextFormat.java:269)
        at com.sun.pdfview.PDFParser.iterate(PDFParser.java:745)
        at com.sun.pdfview.BaseWatchable.run(BaseWatchable.java:101)
        at com.sun.pdfview.BaseWatchable.execute(BaseWatchable.java:263)

        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:908)
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:662)
{code}
fields.summary: Blank Preview in PDF Preview Macro
Confluence Administrator pages are outputing errors to the console

fields.description:
h3. Resolution
Upgrade the JIRA Issues Macro to version 5.0.2 available in Marketplace:

https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/confluence.extra.jira

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Link Confluence 5.2.3 to JIRA 6.0.4 (and potentially other versions) - trusted application link
# Create some issues in JIRA
# Insert a JIRA Issues Macro onto a page, with the following detail:
#- The URL of a single issue
#-- Observe that the Preview displays correctly
#-- Save the page
#-- (/) Observe that the page displays correctly
#- JQL, eg {{project = 'test'}}
#-- Observe that the Preview displays correctly
#-- Save the page
#-- (x) Observe that the column headers are displayed but no issues are
#- A URL from a search, eg {{http://localhost:9604/browse/TEST-3?jql=project%20%3D%20test%20and%20text%20~%20%22description%22}}
#-- Observe that the Preview displays correctly
#-- Save the page
#-- (x) Observe that the column headers are displayed but no issues are

NB: Problems with the JIRA Issues Macro displaying {{($\{entries.size()\} issues)}} after upgrade to 5.2.3 are now being tracked in [CONF-30429|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-30429].
fields.summary: JIRA Issues Macro does not display any data in table view

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce
# Install Linux using the installer
# Specify a particular installation folder
# Once the installer is finished, move the files to another folder
#- Observe that Confluence will not start, and this error appears in the catalina logs (where /opt/ was the original install location):
{code}
/opt/atlassian-confluence-5.2.3/bin/catalina.sh: line 375: /opt/jre//bin/java: No such file or directory
{code}
# Edit setenv.sh and edit JRE_HOME to point to the JRE folder in the new location
#- Observe that Confluence will now start

This should be a relative location based on the location of the script, not hardcoded.
fields.summary: Confluence will not start if the installation files are moved because the Linux Installer hardcodes JRE_HOME in setenv.sh.

fields.description:
When I click in the box to enter a comment I get the "Loading the Editor" message but I wait and wait and nothing happens. It doesn't matter which browser. (Chrome, IE, Firefox, Safari). We have the latest Java version on the server as well as our workstations. 

I used a stopwatch today and after two hours I gave up.The editor never comes up. We are using 5.1.5 of confluence.
fields.summary: Unable to comment on blogs/pages

fields.description:
If you insert an open html comment tag and don't close it in the head section of the custom html then the user side and admin side of confluence will work properly but the websudo page will return a blank page.

The content is there but the "page" div ends up in head and not body and you have to manually move it using Firebug or Chrome Dev Tools.
fields.summary: Websudo screen can be commented out with custom html

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-30374].
  {panel}

To recreate:
1) Create a blank page
2) Select bullet list from toolbar and type something
3) Press enter for new line
4) Backspace to clear bullet and now add "expand" macro
5) Within "expand macro," select numbered list from toolbar

Note that instead of creating a new numbered list within the expand macro, it changes the bullet list before the expand section.

This can be worked around by adding a couple carriage returns to break out of the list element and then re-indenting the "expand" macro, however this has caused some frustration with users.
fields.summary: Expand macro, when created after list, does not allow creating a list within expand section
JIRA issues macro shouldn't change from XML to JQL

fields.summary: Editing from "Edit" link in any of the section headers messes up contents of Code block v 2.0.16 in confluence v 4.3.6

fields.description:
*Steps to Reproduce:*
# Create a Word Document with the following content:
{code}192.168.1.1  test content login test

############################################	
# Test section
# Hashes
#
# More info
############################################{code}
# Import this document into Confluence (via *Tools > Import Word Document*)

*Expected Results:*
The content be copied across verbatim 

*Actual Results:*
!https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/99062/Screen%20Shot%202013-08-13%20at%206.07.13%20PM.png!

*Workaround:*
Use escape character "\", so the content will be:
{code}
192.168.1.1  test content login test

\############################################	
\# Test section
\# Hashes
\#
\# More info
\############################################
{code}
And then perform the import.
fields.summary: Repeated hashes result in deeply nested list when using word importer

fields.description:
If a plugin declares resources like this:

{noformat}
<web-resource key="resources" name="Web Resources">
    <resource type="download" name="my.js" location="my.js"/>
    <context>atl.general</context>
</web-resource>
{noformat}

... my.js will be included from most pages, in a batched js file, as expected.

If batching is disabled according to https://developer.atlassian.com/display/CONFDEV/Web+Resource+Module , like this:

{noformat}
<web-resource key="resources" name="Web Resources">
    <resource type="download" name="my.js" location="my.js">
        <param name="batch" value="false"/>
    </resource>
    <context>atl.general</context>
</web-resource>
{noformat}

... then my.js is no longer loaded at all.

See also https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/181631/using-batch-false-on-a-js-ressource-stops-its-inclusion
fields.summary: Using batch=false on a js resource prevents its inclusion
As an administrator, I want to customise the email format for different types of notifications

fields.description:
Create a user with the username 'aq!@#$'.

Any attempts to use the create dialog or space dialog shows a session timed out error message.
fields.summary: Create dialog shows a session timed out message for users with special characters # or % or / in their name

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Create a user named aq!@#$ and log in
2. Open the restrictions dialog
3. Use the people or group picker
4. Select a user or group and click to submit

Nothing happens (popup window stays open instead of returning the user to the restrictions dialog). Javascript errors appears in the console.
fields.summary: Username with special characters cannot add restrictions using the people or group picker from the dialog

fields.description:
I have just updated to the latest available version of confluence 5.1.5 however I've encountered a bug that seems to have occurred previously:

https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/103858/confluence-save-button-is-not-visible-in-internet-explorer
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/Editor+footer+is+missing+when+editing+a+page+containing+table+in+IE

However in my case the Tiny MCE Editor is fully enabled and I can't see the jira-connector plugin. I do have the JIRA Macros plugin but I am unable to enable it. It occurs with IE 8&9 but editing in Chrome and Firefox is fine. Temp solution is after editing page to reduce the zoom level from 100% to 75% and then back again and the buttons reappear however this has to be done by all users upon every edit.
fields.summary: Save button is not visible in Internet Explorer

fields.description:
1. Open the restrictions dialog for a page (via tools menu, for example)
2. Click 'save'

The dialog does not close as expected. Clicking the 'Save' button will do nothing unless a change is made. It should be disabled to make this clear.
fields.summary: Permissions dialog save button is enabled (but does nothing) before any changes are made
Convert the SecurityHeadersInterceptor into a filter that applies to /*
Ability to move and delete hieararchy
Delete multiple comments
